intro: Aidia, commonly known as the bluebell or bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. These plants are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers, which can range in color from blue to purple and white. Aidia species are typically herbaceous perennials, often found in woodland or rocky habitats. They produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. The genus includes around 100 species, many of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
